originalText.text: Steven helped my family purchase a new construction home and we could not have had a better representative throughout the entire process. Steven is an incredibly thoughtful and proficient problem solver with a remarkable attention to detail. Steven successfully negotiated a sales contract that not only protected our interests, but also allowed us to close on financially favorable terms. Steven always addressed our concerns with care and urgency - including when our basement flooded on the eve of closing. His guidance and skill gave us confidence that everything would be okay in what would have otherwise been a very stressful process. My family and I cannot more highly recommend Steven as an attorney.

originalText.text: I would like to thank Mr. Gee and his staff in handling my first time purchase of a new home and working around the clock with us to close the deal. Steven and his staff provided excellent service, and paid personal attention to all details pertaining to this deal. On more than one occasion, Mr. Gee's attention to detail not only saved my family money at closing but also helped us avoid catastrophic issues that a potential home-buyer can't foresee. I would highly recommend Steven T. Gee, P.C. to any family and friends seeking the need of a punctual, professional, and capable attorney.

originalText.text: Steven came highly recommended to me through numerous family owned businesses in the community. He is extremely capable, and provided me with creative solutions to complex problems. I ultimately concluded that I did not need the services of an Attorney after Steven took the time out to meet with me and provided me with a free legal consultation specific to my case.

originalText.text:
Never seen like this blind lawyer. My first time. No brain , no logic, no knowledge , no eyes , no sense, like a dog in the court . He uses the smell to find clients .  I don’t know why he can still working in this industry.  A reason said several time in a court without evidence.  Even a motion , he doesn’t know what is it . Oh my god.
What a pity .
